intro: Vernonia platyphylla, commonly known as the broadleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats, such as swamps and marshes, and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Vernonia platyphylla plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
